pull.title: docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique
pull.body:
@practicalswift this documents the nit you suggested in my previous PR 
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13707#discussion_r203628395

events.message: docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique

events.body:
Regarding my suggestion in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13707#discussion_r203628395: it should be noted that a nit is just a suggested change for a trivial often non-blocking issue. Not all style nits end up in the developer notes (due to various reasons: no clear consensus, not worth documenting, etc.).

With that out of the way I'm ACK:ing this PR:

The Python documentation is discouraging the use of the old string formatting style (`'%s' % x`):

> **4.7.2. printf-style String Formatting**
> Note: The formatting operations described here exhibit a variety of quirks that lead to a number of common errors (such as failing to display tuples and dictionaries correctly). Using the newer formatted string literals, the str.format() interface, or template strings may help avoid these errors. Each of these alternatives provides their own trade-offs and benefits of simplicity, flexibility, and/or extensibility.

From older Python 3 documentation about `'%s' % x`:

> **5.6.2. Old String Formatting Operations**
> Note: The formatting operations described here are obsolete and may go away in future versions of Python. Use the new String Formatting in new code.

ACK b1b8863fd6fa54fa90f32fd2e384b0f257d0f526

Trivia: When we move to Python 3.6 we can start using [formatted string literals ("f-strings")](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0498/) as well :-)

Thanks. My philosophy is: if it's worth a nit, it's worth documenting (or even better, automating with lint rules) to eliminate review round-trips in the future.

> Trivia: When we move to Python 3.6 we can start using formatted string literals ("f-strings") as well :-)

Nice!
@masonicboom I share your love for automation/linting! ðŸ§ðŸ˜

Concept ACK, no strong feelings on what formatting to use, and please **do not** create PRs that change this all over the place, but for new code it is a good idea to use the new, recommended style consistently.

> F-strings provide a way to embed expressions inside string literals, using a minimal syntax. It should be noted that an f-string is really an expression evaluated at run time, not a constant value. In Python source code

I really like that! string-formatting as a macro-expression. But it will be a while before 3.6 can be required as minimum without breaking a lot of builds. 3.6.0 was released at the end of 2016.

Agree with @practicalswift and @laanwj 

> it should be noted that a nit is just a suggested change for a trivial often non-blocking issue. Not all style nits end up in the developer notes (due to various reasons: no clear consensus, not worth documenting, etc.).

issue.title: commits from bitcoin/master
issue.body:
tests: fixes mininode's P2PConnection sending messages on closing transport
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13715

depends: disable Werror when building zmq
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13689

[trivial] Correct help text for `importaddress` RPC
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13074

wallet: Fix non-determinism in ParseHDKeypath(...). Avoid using an uninitialized variable in path calculation.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13712

Add createwallet "disableprivatekeys" option: a sane mode for watchonly-wallets
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9662

docs: Specify preferred Python string formatting technique
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13718

p2p: Remove dead service bits code
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11637

lint: Add linter for circular dependencies
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13695

Remove boost::program_options dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13482

Fix bitcoin-cli --version
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13725

Utils and libraries: Removes the boost/algorithm/string/join dependency
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13726

wallet: Introduce assertion to document the assumption that cache and cache_used are always set in tandem
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13683

trivial: Replace CPubKey::operator[] with CPubKey::vch where possible
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13722

Remove redundant variables, statements and forward declarations
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13691

doc: Remove field in getblocktemplate help that has never been used.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/12764

Avoid locking mutexes that are already held by the same thread
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/11762

Utils: Refactor ArgsManager a little
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13733

Drop dead code from Stacks
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13633

Net: Fixed a race condition when disabling the network.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13212

trivial: remove unneeded include
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13740

Avoid creating a temporary vector for size-prefixed elements
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13719

tests: Skip P2PConnection's is_closing() check when not available
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13747

issue.title: Bump minimum python version to 3.6
issue.body:
Python 3.5 has reached [end-of-life](https://devguide.python.org/#status-of-python-branches) as of September 2020, and 3.6 has some moderately nice [features](https://docs.python.org/3/whatsnew/3.6.html):

- `f'x = {x}'` as an alternative to `'x = {}'.format(x)` format strings (cf https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13718#issuecomment-406591027)
- underscore separators for large numbers, like `1_234_567` 
- improvements to async
- improvements to typing module

Note that 3.6 is not available in xenial (16.04), but is available in bionic (18.04), while focal (20.04) has 3.8. CentOS 7 and 8 have 3.6.8, Debian stable has 3.7.3, and [gentoo and arch already had 3.6 and 3.7 in 2018](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14954#issuecomment-447118707).

issue.title: test: moved from percent format to proper format for consistency
issue.body:
Simple changes some of the python test related files. 
I converted from the old % format, ex:
"test %s" % "hello"
to the new str.format:
"test {}".format("hello")

This is more modern, as well as more consistent with the rest of the codebase (I have looked around and seen str.format used)
